intro: Sericocarpus linifolius, commonly known as the slenderleaf huskflower, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, dry fruits called achenes, which are often covered in a silky, fine hair. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Sericocarpus linifolius is often found in the northern United States and southern Canada.
